description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of dispersed Dyck paths of length n (i.e., Motzkin paths of length n with no (1,0)-steps at positive heights) having k base pyramids. A base pyramid is a factor of the form U^j D^j (j > 0), starting at the horizontal axis. Here U = (1,1) and D = (1,-1).
